page.title: 11Huntington.Yearsley Grove.
page.content:
Interviews.....Past to Present.
We interviewed five people. Two were over fifty years old. The others were one each from 20-30, 30-40,40-50. They all felt that Huntington was a good place to live,because it has always been near the countryside. The older people remembered when there was a railway line with a station, but now there is a pub: "The Flag and Whistle", where the station used to be. The railway used to go to Hull. The biggest change has been the building of new houses. Twenty years ago Huntington was a quarter the size it is now. Sewerage and water have been introduced in the last thiry years. The roads have been mde wider. The leather factory has disappeared, where a lot of people used to work.
